Package jetbrains.mps.core.aspects.feedback.messages

Interface MessageProvider<C extends Context>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FeedbackProvider<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseMessageProvider
    public interface MessageProvider<C extends Context>
extends FeedbackProvider<C>
    provides custom messages for failed rules

ProblemId forProblemId()

        Returns:

      • feedback

        default void feedback​(@NotNull
                      C context)
        Description copied from interface: FeedbackProvider
        if the provider does not apply to the given context, then it might throw IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise it does some action (=feedback) Namely, that action is supposed to be a reaction to the problem FeedbackProvider.forProblemId()
        Specified by:
        feedback in interface FeedbackProvider<C extends Context>

      • getType

        @NotNull
default FeedbackType getType()
        Specified by:
        getType in interface FeedbackProvider<C extends Context>
        Returns:
        the sort of your feedback. You can show messages, open error dialogs, underline something, even restart MPS. Presumably, the inheritance works only within the single feedback type, meaning different types do not interact with each other.
